metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3619 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The __socket_proto_state_machine function in GlusterFS 3.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a "00000000" fragment header. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled network requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-3619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
glusterfs-common - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
glusterfs-server - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
libgfapi0 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
libgfchangelog0 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
libgfrpc0 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
libgfxdr0 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
libglusterd0 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
libglusterfs0 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu1').
